item.source: Main content box doesn't go centered

item.title: Main content box doesn't go centered
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

With absolute positioning, it can’t calculate the margins to center the element.

#page-wrap {
        position: relative;
	clear: both;
        margin: 20px auto 0; /*top 20px right and left auto bottom 0*/
        width:75%;
        background:#fff;
        padding:15px;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Main content box doesn't go centered
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

margin-left: auto;
margin-right: auto;

Will only work if you have width defined though.

http://www.w3.org/Style/Examples/007/center.en.html

Read full topic
item.source: Main content box doesn't go centered

item.title: Main content box doesn't go centered
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“ReZGaming, post:1, topic:481772”]I’m trying to make this centered but it doesn’t go. When I change it to position:right it goes to the right but when I make it center it just stays to the left.

#page-wrap { position: relative; float: center; top: 20px; width:75%; background:#fff; margin:20px; padding:15px; }[/quote]
This is because the only attributes float can have is left, right, inherit and none. If you want to center something then use the auto width attribute on a margin.

Read full topic
